activity.name: Active Threat Readiness Training
activity.description:
Trident Shield’s online Active Threat Readiness Training course teaches you how to prepare for, prevent, and survive a violent event in the workplace. This program is OSHA and Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Compliant.


You will learn our Four-Part Readiness Program: Prepare, Escape, Hide, Attack by focusing on these core concepts:



Prepare: A significant portion of this course will focus on how to properly Prepare, both before and during a violent event. Preparing before a violent event occurs includes educating yourself on the specific potential risks you may encounter and learning specialized techniques that will help you prevent or survive a violent event. You will also learn how to prepare to take action once a violent event has begun so you have the best chance of success when implementing your Escape, Hide, or Attack response plan.



Prevent: We equip you with the knowledge and confidence to help prevent the majority of safety risks from ever reaching the point of extreme violence. Small changes to your routine will keep you safer throughout your day, and understanding signs and symptoms of domestic violence abuse and behavior changes in coworkers can additionally prevent a potential safety risk from escalating.



Survive: The ‘Skills’ component of the course will cover crucial survival techniques. In these dynamic situations, no single action will be the ‘correct’ answer for all personnel, so our goal is to equip each person with the ability to make their own informed and rational decisions to survive the event.



Safety in all aspects of your life: Throughout the training, the advice and techniques discussed will teach you how to apply the skills both in the workplace and in your personal life.


* For many lessons below, you will see an M to indicate a Mindset you should practice or an S for a Skill that you should practice.

activity.name: Types of workplace violence/map
activity.description:
This section on Workplace Violence and Active Threats includes 5 lessons focusing on defining the issues, workplace and domestic violence, and learning about indicators of potential violence by a coworker or acquaintance. By having a clear understanding of the facts and history of active threat events, you will have a greater chance of preventing violence from occurring in your workplace. 


Let's begin your training on active threats in the workplace with an overview of workplace violence. Workplace violence is any act or threat of physical violence, harassment, intimidation, or other threatening disruptive behavior that occurs at the work site.


Workplace violence can take many forms and it is important that you are aware of the types of violence you may be exposed to. Fortunately, through proper preparation and awareness, many of these events can be avoided or prevented. Click each target area below to learn more. 


When completed, you can then advance using the menu or clicking the arrow below to continue.

activity.name: Recognizing behavioral changes /sorting
activity.description:
Below you will find some behavioral changes that may occur in your workplace. Which changes do you think are significant red flags? Which are behaviors to keep an eye on? Drag each card to the right target to find out! 


When complete, you can continue to the next lesson using the menu or clicking the arrow below.

activity.name: Check for understanding/quiz
activity.description:
You are almost done with this section on Workplace Violence and Active Threats. You learned the definitions of workplace violence and of active threat, as well as important statistics and information on domestic violence and how to recognize behavioral indicators of potential violence in a co-worker. 


Let's check for understanding of the key elements covered in this section. Please answer the 3 questions below.


When complete, you can continue to the next section on Foundational Elements using the menu or clicking the arrow below to continue.

activity.name: Domestic violence, harassment, and homicide are types of workplace violence.

"An emergency situation involving a person or persons actively engaged in killing or attempting to kill people in a populated area by acts of either random or systematic violence" is the definition of:
Which is the correct order for the Behavioral Path of Violence?

component.description: Everyday behavior, threatening behavior, behaviors of concern, extreme behavior violence
Everyday behavior, behaviors of concern, threatening behavior, extreme behavior or violence

activity.name: Applying the situational awareness dial - M/blocks
Check for understanding/quiz
activity.description:
You are almost done with this section on Foundational Elements, which included 5 lessons on the Foundational Elements of Mindset and Skills, situational awareness, inhibitors to situational awareness, and active planning. These essential components combine to better prepare you to avoid, prevent, or survive a violent event. 


Let's check for understanding of the key elements covered in this section. Please answer the 3 questions below. 


When complete, you can continue to the next section on Improvised Weapons using the menu or clicking the arrow below to continue.

component.description: Being aware of what is happening around you in terms of where you are, where you are supposed to be, and whether anyone or anything around you is a threat to your health and safety.
Controlled and repeated exposure to specific stressors to reduce stress symptoms experienced in a critical event.

activity.name: Which of the following is NOT part of the "Three Strikes Rule?"
Normalcy bias is defined as: Disbelieving one's situation when faced with novel, grave and imminent danger, due to the lack of experience or training to be able to appropriately assess and respond.
Improvised weapons/map
activity.description:
This next lesson will help you think of common objects in a new way, as well as teach you how to most effectively use the objects against an attacker. You will first learn some tips about preparing to use an improvised weapon and will then learn some examples of items within each category.


Here are a few improvised weapons tips:

* Take a moment now to locate an object within reach of you that you can use as an improvised weapon and safely practice holding it.


* Don't have anything you can use? Explore the interactive below to see some possible improvised weapons. Make a habit of always having an object identified as your improvised weapon that you can access immediately.


* In a real event, should you need to use your improvised weapon, you must be resolved and commit fully to whatever action you take in order to be effective. Violence of action is critical when defending your life.


Click each target area below to learn more about each of these types of improvised weapons. 


When complete, you can continue to the next lesson from the menu or by clicking on the arrow below.

activity.name: Check for understanding/quiz
activity.description:
You are almost done with this section on Improvised Weapons, which helped you understand how you can use improvised weapons when defending against your attacker. This is a Skill that you can prepare for and rehearse by pre-selecting your improvised weapon and becoming comfortable and efficient at locating and holding it properly. 


Let's check for understanding of the key elements covered in this section. Please answer the 3 questions below.


When complete, you can continue to the next section on Barricading using the menu or clicking the arrow below to continue.

activity.name: For a blunt trauma improvised weapon to be most effective:
Scissors, silverware, and pens are common office items that can be used as which type of improvised weapon?
Why should I pre-select and practice using my improvised weapon?

component.description: I need to understand ahead of an incident if my weapon is best used for blunt trauma, stabbing, slashing, or other so that I know the best way to use it.
I need to determine which weapon system option is the best match for my body size and ability.
I need to know where my chosen improvised weapon will be located in the event of an active threat, so I don't have to waste time searching for one.

activity.name: Barricading - Typical office environment - S/map
activity.description:
When choosing a room to barricade in your office or workspace, select a room that has plenty of movable items that are rigid and non-compressible. Remember that not all spaces can be barricaded easily, especially when working in an open floor plan, such as a warehouse or office with cubicles. Click each marker below to see how each of the items can be used in your barricade. 


When complete, you can continue by choosing the next lesson from the menu or by clicking on the arrow below.

activity.name: Barricading - Home environment - S/map
activity.description:
If you are needing to protect yourself from a home invasion, domestic abuse, or other violent event in your house, your bedroom is often a good location to barricade. If you have young children, you will likely want to plan your barricade for their room, as they may not be able to come to you in an emergency. Click each marker below to learn how each item can be used in your barricade.â€¯ 


When complete, you can continue to the next lesson using the menu or clicking the arrow below.

activity.name: Check for understanding/quiz
activity.description:
You are almost done with this section of Barricading, which included 3 lessons on how to prepare for and execute a proper barricade. This is a skill that you should rehearse both at home and at work.


Let's check for understanding of the key elements covered in this section. Please answer the 3 questions below.


When complete, you can continue to the next section on Firearms using the menu or clicking the arrow below to continue.

activity.name: Which combination of items is more suitable for barricading?

component.description: Desk, rolling office chairs, and several pillows
Bookshelf, coffee table, and several packs of paper

activity.name: In pre-selecting your barricade room, you should look for an:
If you run out of time to completely barricade your room, you should:

component.description: Crouch behind the nearest, largest piece of furniture.
Use your body to fill in the remaining space - lie flat on the floor and wedge yourself tightly between the furniture and the wall.

When complete, you can continue to the next lesson by choosing from the menu or clicking the arrow below.

Click on each marker to learn more about the semi-automatic rifle. 


When complete, you can continue by choosing the next lesson from the menu or by clicking the arrow below.

activity.name: Check for understanding/quiz
activity.description:
You are almost done with this section on Firearms, which included 3 lessons that taught you how semi-automatic pistols and rifles work, but more importantly, how you have the ability to render these firearms useless.


Let's check for understanding of the key elements covered in this section. Please answer the 3 questions below. 


When complete, you can continue to the next section on Ambush using the menu or clicking the arrow below to continue.

activity.name: To disable a pistol or rifle, you must first pull out the magazine that houses the bullets.
Which of the following is the vulnerable part of a semi-automatic rifle that you will be blocking with your hand?
After jamming the firearm, that weapon will no longer be able to function and you can let go of the gun.
Check for understanding/quiz
activity.description:
You are almost done with this section on Ambush Tactics, which highlighted the critical Skill of performing a coordinated attack against the attacker. This is a Skill you should practice as a team, but you should be prepared to respond on your own if necessary.  


Let's check for understanding of the key elements covered in this section. Please answer the 3 questions below.


When complete, you can continue to the next section on Prepare, Escape, Hide, Attack using the menu or clicking the arrow below to continue.

activity.name: There are pre-defined responsibilities for each member of a 3-person ambush team.
When choosing an ambush point, look for one where you are concealed from the attacker until he is within touching distance and where he will see you first.
If I can't find an ambush location, attacking will not be a response option for me.
Check what you've learned/quiz
activity.description: Please answer all 20 questions in this quiz. You will be shown your results after submitting the final question. There is an 80% pass rate for this quiz. If you do not reach 80% on your first attempt, retake the quiz to improve your score.

There are pre-defined responsibilities for each member of a 3-person ambush team.
Attacking is a response option for me, even if I can't find an ambush location.
Safety precautions when barricading during a firearm attack are the same as when barricading during a knife attack.
What is the part you are attacking on a semi-automatic pistol?

A domestic violence issue is a personal problem and I cannot do anything to help a coworker who appears to be suffering abuse.

If you find an object that you believe is a bomb, you should call 911 right away
